Find all the maximal intervals of minimum density  $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$  in the cake-cutting problem with cake  $D$  ,players  $P$  and solid valuation intervals  $\mathcal{D}_{P}$  Let  $H_{1}=\left[h_{1}^{\prime},h_{1}^{\prime\prime}\right)$   $H_{2}=\big[h_{2}^{\prime},h_{2}^{\prime\prime}),.\,.\,.$   $H_{L}=\left[\,h_{L}^{\prime},h_{L}^{\prime\prime}\right)$  be all the maximal intervals of minimum density  $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$   $//\ H_{1},H_{2},.\ .\ .\ ,H_{L}$  are mutually disjoint by Corollary 5 for  $\ell=1$  to  $L$  do cut cake  $D$  at both endpoints  $h_{\ell}^{\prime},h_{\ell}^{\prime\prime}$  of  $H_{\ell}$   $R_{\ell}=\left\{k\in P\;\vert\;D_{k}\subseteq H_{\ell},D_{k}\in\mathcal{D}_{P}\right\}$   $\mathcal{D}_{R_{\ell}}=\left(D_{k}\in\mathcal{D}_{P}:\ k\in R_{\ell}\right)$  CutMaxInterval  $(R_{\ell},H_{\ell},D_{R_{\ell}})$   $P^{\prime}=P;\ D^{\prime}=D$  ；for  $\ell=1$  to  $L$  do P'=P'\Re;  $D^{\prime}=D^{\prime}\setminus H_{\ell}$  if  $P^{\prime}\neq\emptyset\ \ {\bf t h e n}\ //\ P^{\prime}=P\setminus\sum_{\ell=1}^{L}R_{\ell}$  and  $\begin{array}{r}{D^{\prime}=D\setminus\sum_{\ell=1}^{L}H_{\ell}}\end{array}$   ${\mathcal{D}}_{P^{\prime}}^{\prime}=\emptyset$  for each  $D_{k}\in{\mathcal{D}}_{P}$  with  $k\in P^{\prime}$  do  $\begin{array}{r}{D_{k}^{\prime}=D_{k}\setminus\sum_{\ell=1}^{L}H_{\ell};\;\;\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{\prime}=\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{\prime}+\{D_{k}^{\prime}\};}\end{array}$  Perform shrinking of all  $H_{1},H_{2},\dots,H_{L}$   $D^{(S)}$   $D_{k}^{(S)}\in\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{(S)}$   $\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{(S)}$   $D^{\prime}$   $D_{k}^{\prime}\in\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{\prime}$   $\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{\prime}$  by shrinking of all  $H_{1},H_{2},.\,.\,.\,,H_{L}$  ,respectively;  $\mathrm{Cutback}(P^{\prime},D^{(\bar{S})},\mathcal D_{P^{\prime}}^{(S)})$  ;Perform inverse shrinking of all  $H_{1},H_{2},.\,.\,.\,,H_{L}$  
 $P^{\prime}\neq\emptyset$   $H_{1},H_{2},.\,.\,.\,,H_{L}$   $\mathrm{CutCauchy}(P^{\prime},D^{(S)},\mathcal{D}_{P^{\prime}}^{(S)})$   $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}^{\prime}$   $\mathrm{CutCaxe}(P^{\prime},D^{(S)},D_{P^{\prime}}^{(S)})$   $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}^{\prime}>\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$  by Lemma 6. Next, we give a detailed description of CutMaxInterval  $\left(R,H,D_{R}\right)$  based on Lemma 7 and Procedure CutMinInterval  $(S,X,T_{S})$  
# 
Let  $X_{1}=\left[\mathit{x}_{1}^{\prime},\mathit{x}_{1}^{\prime\prime}\right)$  ，  $X_{2}=\left[\,x_{2}^{\prime},x_{2}^{\prime\prime}\right)$   $X_{K}=[\,x_{K}^{\prime},x_{K}^{\prime\prime}\,]$  be all the minimal intervals of minimum density  $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$  in  $H$   $//\;X_{1},X_{2},\ldots,X_{K}$  aremutually disjoint by Corollary 5 for  $k=1$  to  $K$  do  $H$   $x_{k}^{\prime},x_{k}^{\prime\prime}$   $X_{k}$   $S_{k}=\{i\in R\mid D_{i}\subseteq X_{k},D_{i}\in{\mathcal{D}}_{R}\}$   $\mathcal{D}_{S_{k}}=\left(D_{i}\in\mathcal{D}_{R}:\ i\in S_{k}\right)$  CutMinInterval  $(S_{k},X_{k},D_{S_{k}})$   $R^{\prime}=R;\,\,\,H^{\prime}=H$  ；for  $k=1$  to  $K$  do  ${\cal R}^{\prime}={\cal R}^{\prime}\setminus S_{k};\,\,\,{\cal H}^{\prime}={\cal H}^{\prime}\setminus X_{k};$   $R^{\prime}\neq\emptyset$   $\begin{array}{r}{R^{\prime}=R\setminus\sum_{k=1}^{K}S_{k}}\end{array}$   $\begin{array}{r}{H^{\prime}=H\setminus\sum_{k=1}^{K}X_{k}}\end{array}$   ${\mathcal{D}}_{R^{\prime}}^{\prime}=\emptyset$  for  each  $D_{i}\in{\mathcal{D}}_{R}$  with  $i\in R^{\prime}$  do  $\begin{array}{r}{D_{i}^{\prime}=D_{i}\setminus\sum_{k=1}^{K}X_{k}}\end{array}$   ${\cal D}_{R^{\prime}}^{\prime}={\cal D}_{R^{\prime}}^{\prime}+\{{\cal D}_{i}^{\prime}\};$  Perform shrinking of all  $X_{1},X_{2},\ldots,X_{K}$   $H^{(S)}$   $D_{i}^{(S)}\in\mathcal{D}_{R^{\prime}}^{(S)}$   ${\mathcal{D}}_{R^{\prime}}^{(S)}$   $H^{\prime}$   $D_{i}^{\prime}\in{\mathcal{D}}_{R^{\prime}}^{\prime}$   $D_{R^{\prime}}^{\prime}$  by shrinking of all  $X_{1},X_{2},\ldots,X_{K}$  ,respectively;  $\mathrm{CutMaxIntensity}(R^{\prime},H^{(S)},{\mathcal D}_{R^{\prime}}^{(S)})$  ;Perform inverse shrinking of all  $X_{1},X_{2},\ldots,X_{K}$  
 $R^{\prime}\neq\emptyset$   $X_{1},X_{2},\ldots,X_{K}$   $(R^{\prime},H^{(S)},{\mathcal D}_{R^{\prime}}^{(S)})$  is recursively called, then the minimum density  $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}^{\prime}$  in  $\mathrm{CutMaxWeight}(R^{\prime},H^{(S)},\mathcal{D}_{R^{\prime}}^{(S)})$  satisfies  $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}^{\prime}=\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$   by Lemma 7. As mentioned before, Procedure Cut MinInterva  $\mathrm{l}(S,X,{\mathcal{D}}_{S})$  is the core method for solving the cake-cutting problem where cake  $X$  is a minimal interval of minimum density in maximal interval  $H$   of minimum density ,players  $S\!=\!R(X)\!=$   $\rho_{\mathrm{min}}$   $\{i\in R\mid D_{i}\in{\mathcal{D}}_{R},\ D_{i}\subseteq X\}$  and solidvaluation intervals  $\mathcal{D}_{S}=\mathcal{D}_{R(X)}=(D_{i}\in\mathcal{D}_{R}:i\in S)$
